name: keycloak
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing keycloak cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`keycloak` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/mrparkers/terraform-provider-keycloak).

clientTimeout.description: Timeout (in seconds) of the Keycloak client

initialLogin.description: Whether or not to login to Keycloak instance on provider initialization

rootCaCertificate.description: Allows x509 calls using an unknown CA certificate (for development purposes)

tlsInsecureSkipVerify.description:
Allows ignoring insecure certificates when set to true. Defaults to false. Disabling security check is dangerous and
should be avoided.

url.description: The base URL of the Keycloak instance, before `/auth`

defaultLocale.description: The locale to use by default. This locale code must be present within the `supported_locales` list.

supportedLocales.description: A list of [ISO 639-1](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-1_codes) locale codes that the realm should support.

failureResetTimeSeconds.description: When will failure count be reset?

maxLoginFailures.description: How many failures before wait is triggered.

minimumQuickLoginWaitSeconds.description:
How long to wait after a quick login failure.
- `max_failure_wait_seconds ` - (Optional) Max. time a user will be locked out.

permanentLockout.description: When `true`, this will lock the user permanently when the user exceeds the maximum login failures.

quickLoginCheckMilliSeconds.description: Configures the amount of time, in milliseconds, for consecutive failures to lock a user out.

waitIncrementSeconds.description: This represents the amount of time a user should be locked out when the login failure threshold has been met.

contentSecurityPolicy.description: Sets the Content Security Policy, which can be used for prevent pages from being included by non-origin iframes. More information can be found in the [W3C-CSP](https://www.w3.org/TR/CSP/) Abstract.

contentSecurityPolicyReportOnly.description: Used for testing Content Security Policies.

strictTransportSecurity.description: The Script-Transport-Security HTTP header tells browsers to always use HTTPS.

xContentTypeOptions.description: Sets the X-Content-Type-Options, which can be used for prevent MIME-sniffing a response away from the declared content-type

xFrameOptions.description: Sets the x-frame-option, which can be used to prevent pages from being included by non-origin iframes. More information can be found in the [RFC7034](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7034)

xRobotsTag.description: Prevent pages from appearing in search engines.

xXssProtection.description: This header configures the Cross-site scripting (XSS) filter in your browser.

auth.description: Enables authentication to the SMTP server.  This block supports the following arguments:

envelopeFrom.description: The email address uses for bounces.

from.description: The email address for the sender.

fromDisplayName.description: The display name of the sender email address.

host.description: The host of the SMTP server.

port.description: The port of the SMTP server (defaults to 25).

replyToDisplayName.description: The display name of the "reply to" email address.

acceptableAaguids.description: A set of AAGUIDs for which an authenticator can be registered.

attestationConveyancePreference.description: The preference of how to generate a WebAuthn attestation statement. Valid options are `not specified`, `none`, `indirect`, `direct`, or `enterprise`. Defaults to `not specified`.

authenticatorAttachment.description: The acceptable attachment pattern for the WebAuthn authenticator. Valid options are `not specified`, `platform`, or `cross-platform`. Defaults to `not specified`.

avoidSameAuthenticatorRegister.description: When `true`, Keycloak will avoid registering the authenticator for WebAuthn if it has already been registered. Defaults to `false`.

createTimeout.description: The timeout value for creating a user's public key credential in seconds. When set to `0`, this timeout option is not adapted. Defaults to `0`.

relyingPartyEntityName.description: A human readable server name for the WebAuthn Relying Party. Defaults to `keycloak`.

requireResidentKey.description: Specifies whether or not a public key should be created to represent the resident key. Valid options are `not specified`, `Yes`, or `No`. Defaults to `not specified`.

signatureAlgorithms.description: A set of signature algorithms that should be used for the authentication assertion. Valid options at the time these docs were written are `ES256`, `ES384`, `ES512`, `RS256`, `RS384`, `RS512`, and `RS1`.

userVerificationRequirement.description: Specifies the policy for verifying a user logging in via WebAuthn. Valid options are `not specified`, `required`, `preferred`, or `discouraged`. Defaults to `not specified`.

identityProvider.description: The name of the identity provider

userId.description: The ID of the user defined in the identity provider

userName.description: The user name of the user defined in the identity provider

temporary.description: If set to `true`, the initial password is set up for renewal on first use. Default to `false`.

status.description: When specified, keys will be filtered by status. The statuses can be any of `ACTIVE`, `DISABLED` and `PASSIVE`.

evictionDay.description: Minute of day the entry will become invalid on.

evictionHour.description: Hour of day the entry will become invalid on.

maxLifespan.description: Max lifespan of cache entry (duration string).

policy.description: Can be one of `DEFAULT`, `EVICT_DAILY`, `EVICT_WEEKLY`, `MAX_LIFESPAN`, or `NO_CACHE`. Defaults to `DEFAULT`.

kerberosRealm.description: The name of the kerberos realm, e.g. FOO.LOCAL.

keyTab.description: Path to the kerberos keytab file on the server with credentials of the service principal.

useKerberosForPasswordAuthentication.description: Use kerberos login module instead of ldap service api. Defaults to `false`.

browserId.description: Browser flow id, (flow needs to exist)

directGrantId.description: Direct grant flow id (flow needs to exist)

allowRemoteResourceManagement.description: When `true`, resources can be managed remotely by the resource server. Defaults to `false`.

decisionStrategy.description: Dictates how the policies associated with a given permission are evaluated and how a final decision is obtained. Could be one of `AFFIRMATIVE`, `CONSENSUS`, or `UNANIMOUS`. Applies to permissions.

keepDefaults.description: When `true`, defaults set by Keycloak will be respected. Defaults to `false`.

policyEnforcementMode.description: Dictates how policies are enforced when evaluating authorization requests. Can be one of `ENFORCING`, `PERMISSIVE`, or `DISABLED`.

browserId.description: Browser flow id, (flow needs to exist)

directGrantId.description: Direct grant flow id (flow needs to exist)

provider.description:
The provider type for the keycloak package. By default, resources use package-wide configuration
settings, however an explicit `Provider` instance may be created and passed during resource
construction to achieve fine-grained programmatic control over provider settings. See the
[documentation](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/reference/programming-model/#providers) for more information.

should be avoided.

keycloak:index/customUserFederation:Cust.description:
## Import

Custom user federation providers can be imported using the format `{{realm_id}}/{{custom_user_federation_id}}`. The ID of the custom user federation provider can be found within the Keycloak GUI and is typically a GUIDbash

```sh
 $ pulumi import keycloak:index/customUserFederation:CustomUserFederation custom_user_federation my-realm/af2a6ca3-e4d7-49c3-b08b-1b3c70b4b860
```

cachePolicy.description: Can be one of `DEFAULT`, `EVICT_DAILY`, `EVICT_WEEKLY`, `MAX_LIFESPAN`, or `NO_CACHE`. Defaults to `DEFAULT`.

config.description: The provider configuration handed over to your custom user federation provider.

enabled.description: When `false`, this provider will not be used when performing queries for users. Defaults to `true`.

name.description: Display name of the provider when displayed in the console.

parentId.description: Must be set to the realms' `internal_id`  when it differs from the realm. This can happen when existing resources are imported into the state.

priority.description: Priority of this provider when looking up users. Lower values are first. Defaults to `0`.

providerId.description: The unique ID of the custom provider, specified in the `getId` implementation for the `UserStorageProviderFactory` interface.

realmId.description: The realm that this provider will provide user federation for.

keycloak:index/groupRoles:GroupRoles.description:
## Import

This resource can be imported using the format `{{realm_id}}/{{group_id}}`, where `group_id` is the unique ID that Keycloak assigns to the group upon creation. This value can be found in the URI when editing this group in the GUI, and is typically a GUID. Examplebash

```sh
 $ pulumi import keycloak:index/groupRoles:GroupRoles group_roles my-realm/18cc6b87-2ce7-4e59-bdc8-b9d49ec98a94
```

exhaustive.description: Indicates if the list of roles is exhaustive. In this case, roles that are manually added to the group will be removed. Defaults to `true`.

groupId.description: The ID of the group this resource should manage roles for.

realmId.description: The realm this group exists in.

roleIds.description: A list of role IDs to map to the group.

keycloak:index/identityProviderTokenExch.description:
## Import

This resource can be imported using the format `{{realm_id}}/{{provider_alias}}`, where `provider_alias` is the alias that you assign to the identity provider upon creation. Examplebash

```sh
 $ pulumi import keycloak:index/identityProviderTokenExchangeScopePermission:IdentityProviderTokenExchangeScopePermission oidc_idp_permission my-realm/myIdp
```

authorizationIdpResourceId.description: (Computed) Resource ID representing the identity provider, this automatically created by keycloak.

authorizationResourceServerId.description: (Computed) Resource server ID representing the realm management client on which this permission is managed.

authorizationTokenExchangeScopePermissio.description: (Computed) Permission ID representing the Permission with scope 'Token Exchange' and the resource 'authorization_idp_resource_id', this automatically created by keycloak, the policy ID will be set on this permission.

clients.description: A list of IDs of the clients for which a policy will be created and set on scope based token exchange permission.

policyId.description: (Computed) Policy ID that will be set on the scope based token exchange permission automatically created by enabling permissions on the reference identity provider.

policyType.description: Defaults to "client" This is also the only value policy type supported by this provider.

realmId.description: The realm that the identity provider exists in.

clients.description: A list of IDs of the clients for which a policy will be created and set on scope based token exchange permission.

policyType.description: Defaults to "client" This is also the only value policy type supported by this provider.

realmId.description: The realm that the identity provider exists in.

stateInputs.description: Input properties used for looking up and filtering IdentityProviderTokenExchangeScopePermission resources.

realmId.description: The realm that the identity provider exists in.

accessCodeLifespan.description: The maximum amount of time a client has to finish the authorization code flow.

accessCodeLifespanLogin.description: The maximum amount of time a user is permitted to stay on the login page before the authentication process must be restarted.

accessCodeLifespanUserAction.description: The maximum amount of time a user has to complete login related actions, such as updating a password.

accessTokenLifespan.description: The amount of time an access token can be used before it expires.

accessTokenLifespanForImplicitFlow.description: The amount of time an access token issued with the OpenID Connect Implicit Flow can be used before it expires.

actionTokenGeneratedByAdminLifespan.description: The maximum time a user has to use an admin-generated permit before it expires.

actionTokenGeneratedByUserLifespan.description: The maximum time a user has to use a user-generated permit before it expires.

attributes.description: A map of custom attributes to add to the realm.

browserFlow.description: The desired flow for browser authentication. Defaults to `browser`.

clientAuthenticationFlow.description: The desired flow for client authentication. Defaults to `clients`.

defaultSignatureAlgorithm.description: Default algorithm used to sign tokens for the realm.

directGrantFlow.description: The desired flow for direct access authentication. Defaults to `direct grant`.

displayName.description: The display name for the realm that is shown when logging in to the admin console.

keycloak:index/userGroups:UserGroups.description:
## Import

This resource does not support import. Instead of importing, feel free to create this resource as if it did not already exist on the server.

exhaustive.description: Indicates if the list of the user's groups is exhaustive. In this case, groups that are manually added to the user will be removed. Defaults to `true`.

groupIds.description: A list of group IDs that the user is member of.

realmId.description: The realm this group exists in.

userId.description: The ID of the user this resource should manage groups for.

keycloak:index/userRoles:UserRoles.description:
## Import

This resource can be imported using the format `{{realm_id}}/{{user_id}}`, where `user_id` is the unique ID that Keycloak assigns to the user upon creation. This value can be found in the GUI when editing the user, and is typically a GUID. Examplebash

```sh
 $ pulumi import keycloak:index/userRoles:UserRoles user_roles my-realm/b0ae6924-1bd5-4655-9e38-dae7c5e42924
```

realmId.description: The realm this user exists in.

roleIds.description: A list of role IDs to map to the user

userId.description: The ID of the user this resource should manage roles for.

connectionUrl.description: Connection URL to the LDAP server.

customUserSearchFilter.description: Additional LDAP filter for filtering searched users. Must begin with `(` and end with `)`.

editMode.description: Can be one of `READ_ONLY`, `WRITABLE`, or `UNSYNCED`. `UNSYNCED` allows user data to be imported but not synced back to LDAP. Defaults to `READ_ONLY`.

enabled.description: When `false`, this provider will not be used when performing queries for users. Defaults to `true`.

fullSyncPeriod.description: How frequently Keycloak should sync all LDAP users, in seconds. Omit this property to disable periodic full sync.

importEnabled.description: When `true`, LDAP users will be imported into the Keycloak database. Defaults to `true`.

kerberos.description: A block containing the kerberos settings.

searchScope.description:

trustEmail.description: If enabled, email provided by this provider is not verified even if verification is enabled for the realm.

acceptsPromptNoneForwardFromClient.description: When `true`, unauthenticated requests with `prompt=none` will be forwarded to Google instead of returning an error. Defaults to `false`.

alias.description: (Computed) The alias for the Google identity provider.

clientId.description: The client or client identifier registered within the identity provider.

clientSecret.description: The client or client secret registered within the identity provider. This field is able to obtain its value from vault, use $${vault.ID} format.

defaultScopes.description: The scopes to be sent when asking for authorization. It can be a space-separated list of scopes. Defaults to `openid profile email`.

disableUserInfo.description: When `true`, disables the usage of the user info service to obtain additional user information. Defaults to `false`.

displayName.description: (Computed) Display name for the Google identity provider in the GUI.

enabled.description: When `true`, users will be able to log in to this realm using this identity provider. Defaults to `true`.

firstBrokerLoginFlowAlias.description: The authentication flow to use when users log in for the first time through this identity provider. Defaults to `first broker login`.

hideOnLoginPage.description: When `true`, this identity provider will be hidden on the login page. Defaults to `false`.

hostedDomain.description: Sets the "hd" query parameter when logging in with Google. Google will only list accounts for this domain. Keycloak will validate that the returned identity token has a claim for this domain. When `*` is entered, an account from any domain can be used.

internalId.description: (Computed) The unique ID that Keycloak assigns to the identity provider upon creation.

linkOnly.description: When `true`, users cannot login using this provider, but their existing accounts will be linked when possible. Defaults to `false`.

postBrokerLoginFlowAlias.description: The authentication flow to use after users have successfully logged in, which can be used to perform additional user verification (such as OTP checking). Defaults to an empty string, which means no post login flow will be used.

providerId.description: The ID of the identity provider to use. Defaults to `google`, which should be used unless you have extended Keycloak and provided your own implementation.

realm.description: The name of the realm. This is unique across Keycloak.

requestRefreshToken.description: Sets the "access_type" query parameter to "offline" when redirecting to google authorization endpoint,to get a refresh token back. This is useful for using Token Exchange to retrieve a Google token to access Google APIs when the user is offline.

storeToken.description: When `true`, tokens will be stored after authenticating users. Defaults to `true`.

trustEmail.description: When `true`, email addresses for users in this provider will automatically be verified regardless of the realm's email verification policy. Defaults to `false`.

useUserIpParam.description: Sets the "userIp" query parameter when querying Google's User Info service. This will use the user's IP address. This is useful if Google is throttling Keycloak's access to the User Info service.

addReadTokenRoleOnCreate.description: When `true`, new users will be able to read stored tokens. This will automatically assign the `broker.read-token` role. Defaults to `false`.

alias.description: The alias uniquely identifies an identity provider and it is also used to build the redirect uri.

backchannelSupported.description: Does the external IDP support backchannel logout? Defaults to `true`.

clientId.description: The client or client identifier registered within the identity provider.

clientSecret.description: The client or client secret registered within the identity provider. This field is able to obtain its value from vault, use $${vault.ID} format.

defaultScopes.description: The scopes to be sent when asking for authorization. It can be a space-separated list of scopes. Defaults to `openid`.

disableUserInfo.description: When `true`, disables the usage of the user info service to obtain additional user information. Defaults to `false`.

displayName.description: Display name for the identity provider in the GUI.

enabled.description: When `true`, users will be able to log in to this realm using this identity provider. Defaults to `true`.

firstBrokerLoginFlowAlias.description: The authentication flow to use when users log in for the first time through this identity provider. Defaults to `first broker login`.

hideOnLoginPage.description: When `true`, this provider will be hidden on the login page, and is only accessible when requested explicitly. Defaults to `false`.

internalId.description: (Computed) The unique ID that Keycloak assigns to the identity provider upon creation.

linkOnly.description: When `true`, users cannot login using this provider, but their existing accounts will be linked when possible. Defaults to `false`.

loginHint.description: Pass login hint to identity provider.

logoutUrl.description: The Logout URL is the end session endpoint to use to logout user from external identity provider.

postBrokerLoginFlowAlias.description: The authentication flow to use after users have successfully logged in, which can be used to perform additional user verification (such as OTP checking). Defaults to an empty string, which means no post login flow will be used.

providerId.description: The ID of the identity provider to use. Defaults to `oidc`, which should be used unless you have extended Keycloak and provided your own implementation.

realm.description: The name of the realm. This is unique across Keycloak.

storeToken.description: When `true`, tokens will be stored after authenticating users. Defaults to `true`.

trustEmail.description: When `true`, email addresses for users in this provider will automatically be verified regardless of the realm's email verification policy. Defaults to `false`.

uiLocales.description: Pass current locale to identity provider. Defaults to `false`.

validateSignature.description: Enable/disable signature validation of external IDP signatures. Defaults to `false`.

adminUrl.description: URL to the admin interface of the client.

authorization.description: When this block is present, fine-grained authorization will be enabled for this client. The client's `access_type` must be `CONFIDENTIAL`, and `service_accounts_enabled` must be `true`. This block has the following arguments:

baseUrl.description: Default URL to use when the auth server needs to redirect or link back to the client.

clientId.description: The Client ID for this client, referenced in the URI during authentication and in issued tokens.

clientOfflineSessionIdleTimeout.description: Time a client session is allowed to be idle before it expires. Tokens are invalidated when a client session is expired. If not set it uses the standard SSO Session Idle value.

clientOfflineSessionMaxLifespan.description: Max time before a client session is expired. Tokens are invalidated when a client session is expired. If not set, it uses the standard SSO Session Max value.

clientSecret.description: The secret for clients with an `access_type` of `CONFIDENTIAL` or `BEARER-ONLY`. This value is sensitive and should be treated with the same care as a password. If omitted, this will be generated by Keycloak.

clientSessionIdleTimeout.description: Time a client offline session is allowed to be idle before it expires. Offline tokens are invalidated when a client offline session is expired. If not set it uses the Offline Session Idle value.

clientSessionMaxLifespan.description: Max time before a client offline session is expired. Offline tokens are invalidated when a client offline session is expired. If not set, it uses the Offline Session Max value.

consentRequired.description: When `true`, users have to consent to client access.

description.description: The description of this client in the GUI.

directAccessGrantsEnabled.description: When `true`, the OAuth2 Resource Owner Password Grant will be enabled for this client. Defaults to `false`.

enabled.description: When `false`, this client will not be able to initiate a login or obtain access tokens. Defaults to `true`.

excludeSessionStateFromAuthResponse.description: When `true`, the parameter `session_state` will not be included in OpenID Connect Authentication Response.

fullScopeAllowed.description: Allow to include all roles mappings in the access token.

implicitFlowEnabled.description: When `true`, the OAuth2 Implicit Grant will be enabled for this client. Defaults to `false`.

loginTheme.description: The client login theme. This will override the default theme for the realm.

name.description: The display name of this client in the GUI.

pkceCodeChallengeMethod.description: The challenge method to use for Proof Key for Code Exchange. Can be either `plain` or `S256` or set to empty value ``.

realmId.description: The realm this client is attached to.

resourceServerId.description: (Computed) When authorization is enabled for this client, this attribute is the unique ID for the client (the same value as the `.id` attribute).

rootUrl.description: When specified, this URL is prepended to any relative URLs found within `valid_redirect_uris`, `web_origins`, and `admin_url`. NOTE: Due to limitations in the Keycloak API, when the `root_url` attribute is used, the `valid_redirect_uris`, `web_origins`, and `admin_url` attributes will be required.

serviceAccountUserId.description: (Computed) When service accounts are enabled for this client, this attribute is the unique ID for the Keycloak user that represents this service account.

serviceAccountsEnabled.description: When `true`, the OAuth2 Client Credentials grant will be enabled for this client. Defaults to `false`.

standardFlowEnabled.description: When `true`, the OAuth2 Authorization Code Grant will be enabled for this client. Defaults to `false`.

validRedirectUris.description:
A list of valid URIs a browser is permitted to redirect to after a successful login or logout. Simple
wildcards in the form of an asterisk can be used here. This attribute must be set if either `standard_flow_enabled` or `implicit_flow_enabled`
is set to `true`.

webOrigins.description: A list of allowed CORS origins. `+` can be used to permit all valid redirect URIs, and `*` can be used to permit all origins.

encryptAssertions.description: When `true`, the SAML assertions will be encrypted by Keycloak using the client's public key.

encryptionCertificate.description: If assertions for the client are encrypted, this certificate will be used for encryption.

forceNameIdFormat.description: Ignore requested NameID subject format and use the one defined in `name_id_format` instead.

forcePostBinding.description: When `true`, Keycloak will always respond to an authentication request via the SAML POST Binding.

frontChannelLogout.description: When `true`, this client will require a browser redirect in order to perform a logout.

fullScopeAllowed.description: - Allow to include all roles mappings in the access token

idpInitiatedSsoRelayState.description: Relay state you want to send with SAML request when you want to do IDP Initiated SSO.

idpInitiatedSsoUrlName.description: URL fragment name to reference client when you want to do IDP Initiated SSO.

includeAuthnStatement.description: When `true`, an `AuthnStatement` will be included in the SAML response.

logoutServicePostBindingUrl.description: SAML POST Binding URL for the client's single logout service.

logoutServiceRedirectBindingUrl.description: SAML Redirect Binding URL for the client's single logout service.

masterSamlProcessingUrl.description: When specified, this URL will be used for all SAML requests.

name.description: The display name of this client in the GUI.

nameIdFormat.description: Sets the Name ID format for the subject.

realmId.description: The realm this client is attached to.

rootUrl.description: When specified, this value is prepended to all relative URLs.

signAssertions.description: When `true`, the SAML assertions will be signed by Keycloak using the realm's private key, and embedded within the SAML XML Auth response.

signDocuments.description: When `true`, the SAML document will be signed by Keycloak using the realm's private key.

signatureAlgorithm.description: The signature algorithm used to sign documents. Should be one of "RSA_SHA1", "RSA_SHA256", "RSA_SHA512", or "DSA_SHA1".

signingCertificate.description: If documents or assertions from the client are signed, this certificate will be used to verify the signature.

signingPrivateKey.description: If documents or assertions from the client are signed, this private key will be used to verify the signature.

validRedirectUris.description: When specified, Keycloak will use this list to validate given Assertion Consumer URLs specified in the authentication request.

assertionConsumerPostUrl.description: SAML POST Binding URL for the client's assertion consumer service (login responses).

assertionConsumerRedirectUrl.description: SAML Redirect Binding URL for the client's assertion consumer service (login responses).

baseUrl.description: When specified, this URL will be used whenever Keycloak needs to link to this client.

clientId.description: The unique ID of this client, referenced in the URI during authentication and in issued tokens.

clientSignatureRequired.description: When `true`, Keycloak will expect that documents originating from a client will be signed using the certificate and/or key configured via `signing_certificate` and `signing_private_key`.

## Import

This resource does not support import. Instead of importing, feel free to create this resource as if it did not already exist on the server.

clientId.description: The ID of the client to attach default scopes to. Note that this is the unique ID of the client generated by Keycloak.

defaultScopes.description: An array of client scope names to attach to this client.

realmId.description: The realm this client and scopes exists in.

addReadTokenRoleOnCreate.description: When `true`, new users will be able to read stored tokens. This will automatically assign the `broker.read-token` role. Defaults to `false`.

alias.description: The unique name of identity provider.

authenticateByDefault.description: Authenticate users by default. Defaults to `false`.

backchannelSupported.description: Does the external IDP support back-channel logout ?.

displayName.description: The display name for the realm that is shown when logging in to the admin console.

enabled.description: When `false`, users and clients will not be able to access this realm. Defaults to `true`.

entityId.description: The Entity ID that will be used to uniquely identify this SAML Service Provider.

firstBrokerLoginFlowAlias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after first login with this identity provider. Term 'First Login' means that there is not yet existing Keycloak account linked with the authenticated identity provider account. Defaults to `first broker login`.

forceAuthn.description: Indicates whether the identity provider must authenticate the presenter directly rather than rely on a previous security context.

hideOnLoginPage.description: If hidden, then login with this provider is possible only if requested explicitly, e.g. using the 'kc_idp_hint' parameter.

linkOnly.description: When `true`, users cannot login using this provider, but their existing accounts will be linked when possible. Defaults to `false`.

nameIdPolicyFormat.description: Specifies the URI reference corresponding to a name identifier format. Defaults to empty.

postBindingAuthnRequest.description: Indicates whether the AuthnRequest must be sent using HTTP-POST binding. If false, HTTP-REDIRECT binding will be used.

postBindingLogout.description: Indicates whether to respond to requests using HTTP-POST binding. If false, HTTP-REDIRECT binding will be used.

postBindingResponse.description: Indicates whether to respond to requests using HTTP-POST binding. If false, HTTP-REDIRECT binding will be used..

postBrokerLoginFlowAlias.description: Alias of authentication flow, which is triggered after each login with this identity provider. Useful if you want additional verification of each user authenticated with this identity provider (for example OTP). Leave this empty if you don't want any additional authenticators to be triggered after login with this identity provider. Also note, that authenticator implementations must assume that user is already set in ClientSession as identity provider already set it. Defaults to empty.

realm.description: The name of the realm. This is unique across Keycloak.

singleLogoutServiceUrl.description: The Url that must be used to send logout requests.

singleSignOnServiceUrl.description: The Url that must be used to send authentication requests (SAML AuthnRequest).

storeToken.description: When `true`, tokens will be stored after authenticating users. Defaults to `true`.

trustEmail.description: When `true`, email addresses for users in this provider will automatically be verified regardless of the realm's email verification policy. Defaults to `false`.

validateSignature.description: Enable/disable signature validation of SAML responses.

wantAssertionsEncrypted.description: Indicates whether this service provider expects an encrypted Assertion.

wantAssertionsSigned.description: Indicates whether this service provider expects a signed Assertion.

keycloak:index/getRealmKeys:getRealmKeys.description:
Use this data source to get the keys of a realm. Keys can be filtered by algorithm and status.

Remarks:

- A key must meet all filter criteria
- This data source may return more than one value.
- If no key matches the filter criteria, then an error will be returned.

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRealmKeys.

algorithms.description: When specified, keys will be filtered by algorithm. The algorithms can be any of `HS256`, `RS256`,`AES`, etc.

realmId.description: The realm from which the keys will be retrieved.

statuses.description: When specified, keys will be filtered by status. The statuses can be any of `ACTIVE`, `DISABLED` and `PASSIVE`.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRealmKeys.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.

keys.description: (Computed) A list of keys that match the filter criteria. Each key has the following attributes:

inputs.description: A collection of arguments for invoking getRole.

clientId.description: When specified, this role is assumed to be a client role belonging to the client with the provided ID. The `id` attribute of a `keycloak_client` resource should be used here.

name.description: The name of the role.

realmId.description: The realm this role exists within.

outputs.description: A collection of values returned by getRole.

id.description: The provider-assigned unique ID for this managed resource.
